definition: to play the zither/classical variant of 彈琴|弹琴[tan2 qin2]
to comfort/to console/to stroke/to caress/an old term for province or provincial governor
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither

sentences.english: I am going to show you the basic chords and strum patterns.
sentences.chinese: 我会与你们介绍一些最基本的和弦跟抚琴技巧。

sentences.english: And tears are heard within the harp I touch.
sentences.chinese: 我抚琴吟咏，却听到泪水流淌。

sentences.english: The Fuqin St. of Chengdu got its name from their story.
sentences.chinese: 成都的抚琴街就因此而得名。

definition: to play the xiao 簫|箫[xiao1] (mouth organ)/to beg while playing pipes; cf politician Wu Zixu 伍子胥[Wu3 Zi3 xu1], c. 520 BC destitute refugee in Wu town, 吳市吹簫|吴市吹箫[Wu2 shi4 chui1 xiao1]/to busk/virtuoso piper wins a beauty, cf 玉人吹簫|玉人吹箫[yu4 ren2 chui1 xiao1]/(slang) fellatio/blowjob
to play or strum a lute or other stringed instrument
qin and se, two string instruments that play in perfect harmony/marital harmony
to perform a sword-dance
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
to recite poetry
traditional Chinese musical instruments/music
pipa, Chinese lute, with 4 strings, a large pear-shaped body and a fretted fingerboard
to pour wine
to brew tea
to drink alone
guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
to sing a song
to play (musical instrument, esp. string)
tuning/temperament
konghou (Chinese harp)
